commentBody:
The Chinese authorities will have to come to the conclusion, sooner or later, the only way to become a true economic power is when their people DO CREATE the new designs for the enhancing of efficiency in all sectors.

The USA itself for decades stole Britain's and other's inventions to "knock off" the manufacturing in its new country when its independence first happened.

Eventually no economy will prosper if it relies on the creativity of other societies to feed its manufacturing base. China will falter if it doesn't mature.

replies.commentBody: The problem China faces is that its whole system is set up to discourage creativity. For example, the education system is set up to focus on test-taking and conformance with the dictates of the CCCP, not to foster independent thinking.

You're describing the Bush "No child left behind" program in USA education system.      The Chinese ability to perform the LARGEST, FASTEST ECONOMIC EXPANSION IN HISTORY doesn't agree with your thesis.     In fact it is the Chinese who have developed a brand new economic model the West appears to be falling into, with the 0.01% sucking up all the rewards while leaving behind the 99.9% of the "proletariat" behind.
